answers.answer: I have been diabetic for over 20 years (type 1, not 2). I am in no way an expert at Gestational Diabetes, but what you said about when you sit to work and the balls of your foot tingling...in diabetes, that only happens after you have been diabetic for a LONG time and either have not taken care of yourself or have uncontrolled diabetes. I have not heard of many women getting GD this late...but it is possible. My advise is to call your Dr. and ask them to do a test. OR since you have several people in your family with diabetes, ask one of them to use a sterile lancet and check you with their glucose monitor. Do the test either first thing in the morning (fasting) or 2 hours after you eat. If your blood sugar is over 120-130...i would call the Dr as soon as possible.Good Luck!!!!XOXOXChristina

the tingling you could be feeling may not be GD, but rather the baby...since you are at the stage you are....pressing on a nerve....especially since it happens when you sit and not all the time....try changing positions when you sit, or try to move the baby and see if it goes away.....regarding the thirst....you can get GD at a later date...so my suggestion would be to call the doctor and let them know that you can't seem to get enough water even though you drink quite a bit...Hang in there....its not too long now....

my step sisiter developed gestational after her 28 week check her baby was born 9lb6oz her first and just the other day she gave birth to a 7lb9oz baby both boys with no gd detected she had a couple of checks right up to the end.
i told you the other day in a previouse post sounded like diabetes i asked were you thirsty if i were you i would get this checked asap they are all the classic symptoms good luck

i don't remember talking about this before.  i will talk to my dr about it at my next appt.  i have been feeling great lately.  seems like it only happens when i have really overdone it.  this week has been different i have stretched my work out so i don't over do it anymore.  thanks for the help all.

question: hi all, I have a quick question.  I am 33 weeks pg and thru the whole preganancy I have been great at drinking my water.  I drink 80-100oz a day i have only gained 9lbs so far and seems like everything is going great.  however I am a bit of a worry wart.  I had my diabetes test at 28 weeks and all was good.  I do eat one sweet a day and have for the last few months.  Lately I have been giving in to more cravings but nothing really bad.  There are some days I feel really weird like I could just pass out.  Almost like a wave of tiredness but more than that just feels odd.  Last for about twenty mintues and sometimes gets better with eating.  I am so incredibly thirsty even after I drink my water for the day.  Not always but alot of the time.  So I have convinced myself that I have diabetes.  When I sit in my computer chair to work the balls of my feet get tingly......that doesn't help my fear of diabetes.  I feel like such a fool for asking this question but it is weighing very heavy on my mind.  Anyone have any advise or feel the same as me?  What are the chances of getting diabetes after your 28 week test.  There is diabetes in my family but only in a few really heavy people...like my dad who is nearly 600lbs.
title: So thirsy!!!!
